chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Roman E. Mims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roman E. Mims is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Roman E. Mims was found guilty of Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No sentence credit if revoked.
Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Counseling shall specifically include: AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
May not have contact with Joshua Fikejs or his residence, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.   Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

8:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Roman E. Mims in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for Roman E. Mims. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved and agreement is placed on the record. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed. Both parties waive the PSI and request to proceed with sentencing; Court grants request. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 90 days conditional jail. No contact with J.F. or his residence. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. No sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice mailed to defendant. Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Prior: 1504 W 63rd St, Chicago, IL 60636 United States
Notice of assignment of judge returned.   Return to sender.  Attempted, not known.  Unable to forward.

Defendant Roman E. Mims appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
